title: sweidnumbr : Structural handling of swedish identity numbers
text: Installation (Installation) Example: personal identity numbers (Personal identity numbers) Example: organizational identity numbers (Organizational identity number) Licensing Citations (Licensing Citations) References (References)

title: sweidnumbr : Structural handling of swedish identity numbers
text: Install stable release version R: Test installation loading library: also recommend setting UTF-8 encoding:

title: sweidnumbr : Structural handling of swedish identity numbers
text: first step need convert personal identity numbers (pin) standard format used Swedish tax authority. next step test vector pin object. use .pin() function. check format pin. check pin using control number use pin_ctrl(). can now use pin_birthplace() pin_sex(). get information sex birthplace. last step can calculate age based pin. choose date want calculate age. date specified current date used. also possible format pin presentation different forms. (Note however output format_pin just character longer pin object): Sometimes want example pins. can easily simulate pins using rpin():
code: example_pin <- c("640823-3234", "6408233234", "19640823-3230") example_pin <- as.pin(example_pin) example_pin ## [1] "196408233234" "196408233234" "196408233230" ## Personal identity number(s) is.pin(example_pin) ## [1] TRUE pin_ctrl(example_pin) ## [1]  TRUE  TRUE FALSE pin_sex(example_pin) ## [1] Male Male Male ## Levels: Male pin_birthplace(example_pin) ## [1] Gotlands län Gotlands län Gotlands län ## 28 Levels: Stockholm stad Stockholms län Uppsala län ... Born after 31 december 1989 pin_age(example_pin) ## [1] 57 57 57 pin_age(example_pin, date = "2000-01-01") ## [1] 35 35 35 format_pin(example_pin, "%Y-%m-%d-%N") ## [1] "1964-08-23-3234" "1964-08-23-3234" "1964-08-23-3230" format_pin(example_pin, "%P") ## [1] "(19) 64-08-23 - 3234" "(19) 64-08-23 - 3234" "(19) 64-08-23 - 3230" rpin(3) ## [1] "196608237431" "199910204602" "195303286685" ## Personal identity number(s)

title: sweidnumbr : Structural handling of swedish identity numbers
text: Handling organizational identity numbers done similar fashion. organizational numbers allowed one format. can test vector correct format similar way pin. vector oin can check organizational number correct. can also check type organization. Sometimes want example oins. can easily simulate oins using roin():
code: example_oin <- c("556000-4615", "232100-0156", "802002-4280") example_oin <- as.oin(example_oin) example_oin ## [1] "556000-4615" "232100-0156" "802002-4280" ## Organizational identity number(s) is.oin(example_oin) ## [1] TRUE oin_ctrl(example_oin) ## [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE oin_group(example_oin) ## [1] Aktiebolag                              ## [2] Stat, landsting, kommuner, församlingar ## [3] Ideella föreningar och stiftelser       ## 3 Levels: Aktiebolag ... Stat, landsting, kommuner, församlingar roin(3) ## [1] "244615-5893" "653157-3092" "379534-6562" ## Organizational identity number(s)

title: Handling of Swedish Identity Numbers
text: sweidnumbr R package structural handling identity numbers used swedish administration personal identity numbers (personnummer) organizational identity numbers (organisationsnummer).

title: Handling of Swedish Identity Numbers
text: install CRAN just write: Use devtools package install latest version GitHub: tutorial included package can viewed :

title: Handling of Swedish Identity Numbers
text: Please use GitHub issue tracker reporting bugs making feature requests. IMPORTANT: submitting bug, can make lives developers easier submitting following information along bug report: output sessionInfo() output packageVersion("sweidnumbr")

what: Parse personal identity numbers to ABS format — as.pin
title: Parse personal identity numbers to ABS format — as.pin
text: .pin Converts personal identity numbers different formats standard (ABS)  pin format YYYYMMDDNNNC YYYYMMDD date birth, NNN  birth number C control number. .pin checks wether R object class "pin".

title: Parse personal identity numbers to ABS format — as.pin
Parse personal identity numbers to ABS format — as.pin
text: pin Vector swedish personal identity numbers character numeric format.  See details.

title: Parse personal identity numbers to ABS format — as.pin
text: .pin returns vector class "pin" (additional classes "AsIs" character)  swedish personal identity numbers standard ABS format "YYYYMMDDNNNC". .pin returns TRUE pin class "pin", otherwise FALSE.

title: Parse personal identity numbers to ABS format — as.pin
text: .pin converts different formats swedish personal identity numbers standard ABS format. formats can converted : numeric: YYYYMMDDNNNC numeric: YYMMDDNNNC (assuming < 100 years age) character: "YYYYMMDDNNNC" character: "YYMMDD-NNNC",  "YYMMDD+NNNC" character: "YYYYMMDD-NNNC" character: "YYMMDDNNNC" (assuming < 100 years age) ("C" can substituted characters "", "T" "X" "YYYY" < 1967).

title: Parse personal identity numbers to ABS format — as.pin
text: Skatteverket, Population registration Sweden, SKV 717B (2007) Skatteverket, Personnummer, SKV 704 (2007) SOU 2008:60 : Personnummer och samordningsnummer (2008) Personnummer: information fran Centrala folkbokförings- och uppbördsnämnden. (1967). Stockholm Den svenska folkbokföringens historia tre sekel. (1982). Solna: Riksskatteverket URL

title: Formatting pin — format_pin
Formatting pin — format_pin
text: x vector class "pin" (see .pin) vector can coerced format. character string specifying output format.  %N used reference last four digits pin. Format date handled via strptime. ("%Y%m%d%N" default). %P available   shorthand "(%C) %y-%m-%d - %N", format aimed  maximal readability used long lists ... arguments passed format.Date

title: Calculate the birthplace of pin — pin_birthplace
text: possible calculate people born (/person immigrated)  personal identity number. possible people born  1990 1945. people born 1946 birthplace identifier contains information one registered 1st november 1946. Personal identity numbers people born 1989 contain information birthplace. period 1946 - 1989 pin also contains information whether one  immigrated Sweden period.

what: Generate a vector of random pin — rpin

text: function generates random pins (see .pin).  generated pin uniformely distributed time period.

title: Generate a vector of random pin — rpin
code: rpin(   n,   start_date = "1900-01-01",   end_date = Sys.Date(),   p.male = 0.5,   p.coordn = 0.1 )

title: Generate a vector of random pin — rpin
text: n number observations. length(n) > 1, length taken number required. start_date Smallest possible pin. Default 1900-01-01. end_date Largest possible pin. Default current date. p.male Proportion males. Default 0.5. p.coordn Proportion coordination numbers. Default 0.1.

title: Generate a vector of random pin — rpin
text: vector generated pins.
